question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

4. This verification must be reported by at least two major, reputable news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:
- No such mission takes place by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but does not fulfill all the above criteria.
- The Orion spacecraft is used solely for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return journey.

Note: This inquiry does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return journeys from the ISS are considered for resolution.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the cholera outbreak in Yemen no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the cholera outbreak in Yemen is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the cholera outbreak in Yemen is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Yemeni cholera outbreak, not a global cholera situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about cholera that does not specifically address the Yemeni outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Yemeni cholera outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Yemeni cholera outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Ghana receive mpox vaccines from the United States by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Ghana is confirmed to have received mpox vaccines from the United States. The confirmation must come from official statements by Ghana's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Ghana. If no such confirmation is made by the resolution date, or if Ghana receives mpox vaccines from a source other than the United States, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Ghana acquire mpox vaccines from the US by the end of August 2024?
question.body: This question will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is verification that Ghana has obtained mpox vaccines from the US. Verification must be provided through official announcements by Ghana's health ministry or through reports from at least two trustworthy international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be intended specifically for combating the mpox outbreak in Ghana. If no such verification is available by the resolution date, or if Ghana acquires mpox vaccines from a source other than the US, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Pakistan become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pakistan is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include Pakistan as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Pakistan's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Is Pakistan set to join the BRICS group by August 2024?
question.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pakistan is officially recognized as a member of the BRICS group. For an affirmative outcome, the recognition must be validated through formal declarations from the BRICS group or any of its constituent nations (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The official recognition must entail Pakistan as a complete member, not merely an observer or associate member. If such recognition does not occur by the decision date, or if Pakistan's membership remains pending or under review, the inquiry concludes with a NO.
